item.title: Humanitarian Aid Is 'Broken,' Says Former U.N. Official
item.description: June 22, 2017 - The way we offer assistance to people fleeing conflict no longer works, says Paul Spiegel, a former director of program management at the U.N. refugee agency. He has a few ideas about how to fix it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - The way we offer assistance to people fleeing conflict no longer works, says Paul Spiegel, a former director of program management at the U.N. refugee agency. He has a few ideas about how to fix it. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/22/533639073/what-s-wrong-with-humanitarian-aid

item.title: Senators Working On Health Care Revision Ready To Release Their Plan
item.description: June 22, 2017 - The legislation Senate Republicans are releasing is expected to track the House version that was passed last month. Negotiations have been going on in secret.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - The legislation Senate Republicans are releasing is expected to track the House version that was passed last month. Negotiations have been going on in secret. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/22/533922318/senators-working-on-health-care-revision-ready-to-release-their-plan

item.title: Republicans' Proposed Medicaid Cuts Would Hit Rural Patients Hard
item.description: June 22, 2017 - Hundreds of rural hospitals are on the brink of closing. The House Republican health plan drastically reduces one of their key sources of funding and the Senate bill is expected to do the same.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - Hundreds of rural hospitals are on the brink of closing. The House Republican health plan drastically reduces one of their key sources of funding and the Senate bill is expected to do the same. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/22/533680909/republicans-proposed-medicaid-cuts-would-hit-rural-patients-hard

item.title: Spillover Beasts: Which Animals Pose The Biggest Viral Risk?
item.description: June 21, 2017 - Rodents, primates and bats likely carry hundreds of thousands of viruses we haven't yet identified. But how do you know which ones might infect humans?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 21, 2017 - Rodents, primates and bats likely carry hundreds of thousands of viruses we haven't yet identified. But how do you know which ones might infect humans? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/21/533702513/spillover-beasts-which-animals-pose-the-biggest-viral-risk

item.title: 'Combat Medicine:' Afghanistan Vet Seeks To Help Others Through Hip-Hop
item.description: June 21, 2017 - A new hip-hop album by a veteran of the war in Afghanistan drops Wednesday. His target audience: fellow vets suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 21, 2017 - A new hip-hop album by a veteran of the war in Afghanistan drops Wednesday. His target audience: fellow vets suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/21/533792166/combat-medicine-afghanistan-vet-seeks-to-help-others-through-hip-hop

item.title: CEOs Say They'll Sell Health Insurance Next Year, But Are Flying Blind
item.description: June 21, 2017 - Health insurers have to let the government know Wednesday if they'll be selling policies on the federal exchange next year. But Congress has yet to tell them what those policies will cover.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 21, 2017 - Health insurers have to let the government know Wednesday if they'll be selling policies on the federal exchange next year. But Congress has yet to tell them what those policies will cover. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/21/533808635/ceos-say-theyll-sell-health-insurance-next-year-but-are-flying-blind

item.title: What's Washington Got To Hide?
item.description:
June 21, 2017 - It seems like more and more of the U.S. government's business is taking place behind closed doors. What aren't we being told, and why?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-21/whats-washington-got-to-hide
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 21, 2017 - It seems like more and more of the U.S. government's business is taking place behind closed doors. What aren't we being told, and why? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-21/whats-washington-got-to-hide

item.title: Survivors Of Childhood Diseases Struggle To Find Care As Adults
item.description: June 21, 2017 - A few decades ago, babies born with conditions such as congenital heart disease or cystic fibrosis often didn't survive past childhood. Now many live longer, but adult medicine has not kept pace.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 21, 2017 - A few decades ago, babies born with conditions such as congenital heart disease or cystic fibrosis often didn't survive past childhood. Now many live longer, but adult medicine has not kept pace. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/21/532601431/survivors-of-childhood-diseases-struggle-to-find-care-as-adults

item.title: Here's What We Know About The Senate GOP Health Care Bill
item.description:
June 20, 2017 - Senate Republicans say they will release a draft of their legislation on Thursday, with a vote likely next week.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/06/20/533693744/heres-what-we-know-about-the-senate-gop-health-care-bill

item.title: Dramatic Increase In Number Of People Being Hospitalized Due To Opioids
item.description: June 20, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish speaks with Dr. Traci Green, deputy director of injury prevention at Boston Medical Center about the stunning show increase in the number of hospital visits related to opioids.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish speaks with Dr. Traci Green, deputy director of injury prevention at Boston Medical Center about the stunning show increase in the number of hospital visits related to opioids. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/20/533698463/dramatic-increase-in-number-of-people-being-hospitalized-due-to-opioids

item.title: A Pioneer In 'Flat-Fee Primary Care' Had To Close Its Clinics. What Went Wrong?
item.description: June 20, 2017 - Many patients liked the Qliance approach, which gave them unlimited access to a provider for a modest fee and freed doctors from insurance paperwork. But critics say the approach may not be viable.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - Many patients liked the Qliance approach, which gave them unlimited access to a provider for a modest fee and freed doctors from insurance paperwork. But critics say the approach may not be viable. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/20/533562142/a-pioneer-in-flat-fee-primary-care-had-to-close-its-clinics-what-went-wrong

item.title: Opioid Overdoses: Mass Casualty Zones In America
item.description:
June 20, 2017 - Last year alone, more Americans died from drug overdoses than were lost fighting the war in Vietnam.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-20/opioid-epidemic-placeholder-headline

item.title: 6 Members Of The Presidential Advisory Council On HIV/Aids Resign
item.description: June 20, 2017 - Steve Inskeep talks to Dr. Michelle Ogle of the Warren-Vance Community Health Center in Henderson, N.C., about why she chose to resign from the advisory council. Five others also left the panel.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - Steve Inskeep talks to Dr. Michelle Ogle of the Warren-Vance Community Health Center in Henderson, N.C., about why she chose to resign from the advisory council. Five others also left the panel. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/20/533617483/6-members-of-the-presidential-advisory-council-on-hiv-aids-resign

item.title: Study Finds Yoga Can Help Back Pain, But Keep It Gentle, With These Poses
item.description: June 20, 2017 - A yoga class designed specifically for lower back pain can be as effective as physical therapy in easing pain, the study says. The class and teacher manuals are available online, for free.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - A yoga class designed specifically for lower back pain can be as effective as physical therapy in easing pain, the study says. The class and teacher manuals are available online, for free. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/20/533505211/study-finds-yoga-can-help-back-pain-but-keep-it-gentle-with-these-poses

item.title: When Sleeping In The Car Is The Price Of A Doctor Visit
item.description: June 20, 2017 - The Remote Area Medical charity holds dozens of free health clinics each year. Low-income patients waited in their cars and on blankets for the clinic to open one recent Saturday morning.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - The Remote Area Medical charity holds dozens of free health clinics each year. Low-income patients waited in their cars and on blankets for the clinic to open one recent Saturday morning. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/20/533210947/when-sleeping-in-the-car-is-the-price-of-a-doctor-visit
